title: Internet Speeds:Chennai Has Fastest Broadband, Mumbai Has Best 4G Speeds In India As Per Ookla Speedtest Report
text:
Chennai Has Fastest Broadband, Mumbai Has Best 4G Speeds In India As Per Ookla Speedtest Report

Chennai Has Fastest Broadband, Mumbai Has Best 4G Speeds In India As Per Ookla Speedtest Report

The company behind internet speed test website Speedtest.net - Ookla - has shared a report today revealing the status of internet infrastructure and speeds in India.

Representative Image: Reuters

As per its report, India has seen a decent 16.5 percent increase in download speeds in the mean fixed broadband category, during the second and third quarters this year, with a maximum download speed of 34.07Mbps in September.

India stands on top in mean broadband speeds in comparison to its neighbouring countries Pakistan and Bangladesh, both maxing out its speeds at 9.14Mbps and 24.02Mbps respectively.

The report also stated that with the rollout of Jio's GigaFiber internet connections, mean fixed broadband speeds would continue to rise across the country.

However, when you see at mobile data download speeds, the story is entirely different. There was no considerable improvement in mobile download speeds with the maximum fluctuating between 10.63Mbps and 11.18Mbps. These speeds are considerably lower than the speeds found in Pakistan (maxing out at 15.55Mbps) and Bangladesh (maxing out at 10.43Mbps).

The report also shed some light on the availability of 4G network in the country. The report revealed that India continues to get stronger with its 4G connectivity. 4G availability was high at 87.9 percent across providers during the second and third quarter of 2019. It is considerably higher than our neighbours with Pakistan and Bangladesh at 85.9 percent and 58.7 percent respectively.

Representative Image: Reuters

Variation in speeds in accordance with broadband and mobile connections

When comparing broadband speeds between cities, there was a considerable difference between. For example, The fastest broadband was in Chennai at 51.07Mbps followed by Bengaluru at 42.50Mbps and Hyderabad at 41.68Mbps. Slowest broadband speeds were witnessed in Nagpur at 20.10Mbps followed by Pune at 22.78Mbps and Kanpur at 23.20Mbps.

Similar comparision with mobile network however showered minimal differences between cities. Mumbai had the best mobile internet 4G speeds at 11.87Mbps followed by Indore at 11.80Mbps, Vishakapatnam at 11.74Mbps, Hyderabad at 11.48Mbps and Kolkata at 11.46Mbps.
